sense.name: a large quantity
sense.examples: I made a lot of beef stew, so please help yourself. There are lots of companies trying to get into search technology. A lot of people have gone through the same experience. There is not a lot of confidence in his plane.

sense.name: a parcel of land
sense.examples: We are buying a wooded lot by the lake. Developers have turned the old Brown farm into twenty lots for new homes.

sense.name: fate or destiny, one's existence
sense.examples: Her lot should have been a happier one. Their lot has been to remain an industry leader despite economic setbacks. The lot of the indicted CEO remains to be seen. Our dog seems to enjoy his lot in life.

sense.name: any collection in its entirety
sense.examples: I threw the lot of them in the trash. Tell John to send the lot of them away! Despite her better judgement, Mary took in the lot of stray kittens.

sense.name: a social set or clique of friends
sense.examples: He hangs out with a strange lot. They were a drunken lot last night, weren't they?

sense.name: small artifact drawn by chance by contestants
sense.examples: We drew lots to see who would go first. Which lot did you pick, the short or the long straw?

sense.name: units of merchandise
sense.examples: The discount store is selling odd lots of canned fruit. The truck was loaded with several lots of outdoor furniture.
